Articles.Content: Floor 724: Felix Baumgartner is just about to jump out of a window.
Floor 725: The previous floors seem to get farther, and farther away as you notice a active rocket engine.

Floor 726

The previous floor stops moving, because you slammed your head into the ceiling. You go to the emergency staicase, and when you look down, you almost need to puke.

Floor 728:

On this floor is a jar of marmite. No one knows why.

Floor 729:

on this floor is a tub of vegemite. No one wants to know why...

Floor 730:

You got to the top! Suddenly you hear an explosion, and more staircase begins to grow!

Floor 731:

Hmmm... deja vu...

Floor 732:

The source of cuteness in everything cute
Floor 733: You see the ISS... Realizing this is a Space elevator.
Floor 734: just a stair

Floor 735:

A pool full of squids.

Right.

Moving along now.

Floor 736:

We are the Canadian Borg. Resistance would be impolite, eh.

Floor 737:

You notice this floor looks suspiciously like the inside of a Boeing aircraft.

Floor 738: A sinusoÃƒÂ¯dal painting on each wall

Edited June 1, 2014 by WinkAllKerb''

Floor 738: You walk into an MC Escher Painting and find yourself on Floor 666

It "technically" works...
Floor 739: You find yourself in 2001: A Space Odyssey's Ã¢â‚¬â€¹BEYOND THE INFINITE!
Floor 740: The room is abandoned, and there is a strange, glowing blue gun with the words "Aperture Science" written on the side.
Floor 741: Full of elevators. They all lead out of the building.
Floor 742: There's a sign that says: 'There are no easter eggs up here, go away'.
Floor 743: no wall ground or roof just some fresh born birds
Floor 744: You hear a voice say: 'Stanley wondered how anyone could build a tower so tall'.
Floor 745: The gravity decreases ever so slightly (wormhole 20 floors above you).
Floor 745: The gravity increases.
Floor 746: You are now walking on the ceiling, which is rather disorienting.

Floor 747:

The ceiling becomes the ground. You are perfectly oriented now, just the light looks weird sticking off the ground.
